text: The Max Planck Institute for Comparative and International Private Law (Max- Planck-Institut für ausländisches und internationales Privatrecht, MPIPRIV) is a legal research institute located in Hamburg, Germany. It is operated by the Max Planck Society. Founded in 1949, it is the successor institution of the Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Foreign and International Private Law, which was founded in 1926."Academic History." Max Planck Institute for Comparative and International Private Law. Retrieved 15 September 2015. Since 1956 it is based in Hamburg's district of Rotherbaum. == See also == * Max Planck Society * University of Hamburg == References == Comparative and International Private Law Category:Legal research institutes Category:Organisations based in Hamburg Category:Buildings and structures in Eimsbüttel
title: Max Planck Institute for Comparative and International Private Law
